column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/p4437_de79aaa7a9ad07664461ee8735299aa68c630969/ for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-te
It's unfortunate that util depends on uint256, otherwise this could go to\ncommon lib instead of util lib.\n
@sipa Maybe after #4400 it could. AFAIK bitcoin-cli doesn't use any random functionality.\n
@sipa @laanwj Trivial to fix.  Current master only shows util.{h,cpp} needing uint256 in a single function: GetRandHash()  "Rand" stuff should arguably move to crypto/ anyway.  Problem solved.\n

Also, #4332 adds the core_{read,write} modules as a home for converting from hex/json-to-core data structure (and the reverse direction).  Some hex parsing can be moved there, or to a separate hex module.  

Shrink util.  :)
@jgarzik yes, see #4400. It moves the Rand stuff to a separate file. We decided not to move it to crypto because it still relies on OpenSSL but that could be done at a later time.\n
